p: Conversely, total percent of time investigating non-food items (enrichment and non-enrichment combined) was lower when foraging enrichment was given (10.95 ± 1.54% of time) compared to when exploring enrichment was given (16.41 ± 2.22% of time; F 1,12 = 14.475, p = 0.002). There was a significant difference in total time investigating non-food items based on which enrichment item was given (F 6,45 = 3.143, p = 0.012; Figure 4; Table S6).
